page.title: 04THE YELLOW BRIDGE
page.content: There is a little foot bridge over the Faughan that was built by a{blacksmith {called James Marshal.}His forge was along the main Londonderry ,Belfast road.It is now a cowshed. The bridge is sixteen metres long and made up of sixteen wrought iron crosses each one metre long metre long the floor is made of wood. His name is engraved on iron. It was built so people could come to school and church across the {Faughan}without having to go miles to the nearest road bridge. It is six steps up from the ground at one side and level at the other side.
